title: Erdős #234: Density of Normalized Prime Gaps

problemStatement.formal: \forall c \geq 0: f(c) := \lim_{N\to\infty} \frac{|\{n \leq N : g_n/\log n < c\}|}{N} \text{ exists and is continuous}
problemStatement.plain: Does the density f(c) of integers n with (p_{n+1} - p_n)/log n < c exist for all c ≥ 0, and is it a continuous function of c?
whyMatters: Fundamental question about prime gap distribution
Connects to Riemann Hypothesis via Gallagher's work

proven: Gallagher (1976): Under RH, normalized gaps have exponential distribution
knownResults.goal: Prove density exists and is continuous (unconditionally)

currentState.focus: Complete formalization with RH-conditional result and Cramér model.

knowledge.progressSummary: ACTIVE (OPEN): Erdos234Problem.lean (252 lines, 8 axioms, 2 sorries). Full infrastructure for prime gap density. Cramér prediction defined and properties stated. Gallagher conditional result axiomatized. gallagher_implies_conjecture PROVED.
insights: Cramér model: f(c) = 1 - e^{-c} is the predicted form
Key difficulty: needs joint distribution of all normalized gaps
Connection to Problem #233 (sum of squared gaps)

papers: Cramér (1936): On the order of magnitude of prime gaps
Gallagher (1976): On the distribution of primes in short intervals
Erdős (1935, 1940): On the difference of consecutive primes
